place.name: INGHAM
place.gazetteerText: INGHAM, a village and a parish in the district and county of Lincoln. The village stands on the Wolds, 6½ miles NE of Saxelby r. station, and 8¼ miles N by W of Lincoln. The parish comprises 1, 750 acres. Posttown, Fillingham, under Lincoln. Real property, £3, 249. Pop., 646. Houses, 147. The manor belongs to Col. Neville. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £50. * Patron, Col. Neville. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
